column4: I just installed ubuntu 9.10 and updated and rebooted as it asked me to... and now it wont login it just accepts the password, trys to login, then crashes back to login prompt
try select session "gnome failsafe" before login, then try debug/fix problem, then remember to switch back to "gnome" when it works
the login issue but it worked in failsafe what do I do now
grub is not involved when logging in. i would suspect old settings not compatible with new programs if login fails after upgrade (settings in dot-files in home folder)

copy all dot-files to a temporary folder (e.g. called "dot-file-backup/") and see if login works (all your themes and mails will be gone) then dot files back one at a time , logout and login, and see when it stops working, that is the offending dotfile. then copy all other dotfiles back and themes and mails should be back.
there has to be a less tedius way..
yes, see log files and google suspect error messages
there should be a .xsession-errors after you have loggen in in a graphical environment (as opposed to text mode) its a hidden file so you need ls -a or control-h in the file browser
I found it but google is failing me :(
what about creating a new user, e.g. "alterego" and login into that, see if that work. then old dotfiles are even more likely the cause.
does login into a new user "alterego" fail? not good then
